*Sigma Binary* v1.5.0

With this update the mod now works on KSP 1.1

Requires **Kopernicus 1.0** and **the latest modulemanager** (<u>download them separately</u>)

[all the links are available in the OP](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/115114-/)

If you want to follow the development of my mods: [![Sigma88Mods&style=social](https://img.shields.io/twitter/follow/@Sigma88Mods.svg?link=https://twitter.com/Sigma88Mods&style=social)](https://twitter.com/intent/follow?screen_name=Sigma88Mods)

If you want to buy me a cup of coffee:  [![iSFDI5f.png](http://i.imgur.com/iSFDI5f.png)](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=65VBNHB39BTKG&lc=GB&item_name=Sigma88&currency_code=EUR&bn=PP-DonationsBF%3Abtn_donateCC_LG.gif%3ANonHosted) [![r8916yD.png](http://i.imgur.com/r8916yD.png)](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=65VBNHB39BTKG&lc=GB&item_name=Sigma88&currency_code=USD&bn=PP-DonationsBF%3Abtn_donateCC_LG.gif%3ANonHosted)

*Sigma Binary* v1.5.1

With this update the mod now works on KSP 1.1.2

Requires **Kopernicus 1.0.3** and **the latest modulemanager** (<u>download them separately</u>)

[all the links are available in the OP](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/115114-/)

If you want to follow the development of my mods: [![Sigma88Mods&style=social](https://img.shields.io/twitter/follow/@Sigma88Mods.svg?link=https://twitter.com/Sigma88Mods&style=social)](https://twitter.com/intent/follow?screen_name=Sigma88Mods)

Changelog:

    v1.5.1
    
    - Updated to KSP 1.1.2 and Kopernicus 1.0.3
    - Fixed a bug with binary systems outside the orbit of Jool

Nice mod! I'll have to mess around with this![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") is it possible to make other objects orbit a barycenter without messing with it? Ex: minimus around kerbin-mun?

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, Kepler68 said:
> 
> 
> Nice mod! I'll have to mess around with this![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") is it possible to make other objects orbit a barycenter without messing with it? Ex: minimus around kerbin-mun?
> 

no, it's better to leave minmus to orbit kerbin. KSP doesn't really like barycenters and putting something in orbit around them will most likely cause more issues than it solves

Hey [@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/)!!! Is this necessarily good???

![p96TQju.png](http://i.imgur.com/p96TQju.png)

That, my friend, is what you call a small star ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
Is it possible to apply rings to a barycenter?

> 
> 
> 38 minutes ago, Kepler68 said:
> 
> 
> Is it possible to apply rings to a barycenter?
> 

Yep. Just make the barycenter and make a MM cfg.

> 
> 
> 58 minutes ago, RA3236 said:
> 
> 
> Yep. Just make the barycenter and make a MM cfg.
> 

Okay, does it tell me what the barycenter is named and does it need to be after Kopernicus and sigmabinary together?

> 
> 
> Just now, Kepler68 said:
> 
> 
> Okay, does it tell me what the barycenter is named and does it need to be after Kopernicus and sigmabinary together?
> 

Okay, I'm writing SCF as we are speaking, so this will be QUICK.

    @Kopernicus:AFTER[SigmaBinary]
    {@Body[-] //the barycenter's name. It will probably be Body1Body2, or KerbinMun for example{	%Rings	{} //add whatever}
    }

Got an error when loading sigma binary 1.5.2 with OPM. It appears to be a ModuleManager error having to do with Sigma/Binary/Configs/generateBarycenters.cfg

[https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6ZYgATQfNhBdlZMZ2Y0WUhUd1U](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B6ZYgATQfNhBdlZMZ2Y0WUhUd1U)

[@theonegalen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/71012-theonegalen/) there are multiple errors in the log you sent me, most of them don't look like they should be related to SigmaBinary

but, I am unable to reproduce your issue on this install:

KSP 1.1.2  

MM 2.6.25 (tried also with 2.6.24)  

Kopernicus 1.0.4 (tried also with 1.0.5)  

OPM 2.0 (tried also with 1.9.5)  

SB 1.5.2

this means that probably the error could stem from one of the other errors I see in the logs.

you could try to narrow down the number of mods in your install untill you find which one is causing the issue

This is a KSPRC bug so you'll need to wait for [@Proot](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/98932-proot/) to fix it

I don't think it will take long since the solution is pretty simple ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Geschosskopf said:
> 
> 
> OPM comes with a config file for Custom Asteroids that adds asteroid moonlets to Jool and the OPM planets.  But it you have SigmaBinary installed, you no longer have the "Plock" that the OPM config file wants, but Plock-Karen.  So I made a little ModuleManager file so the Plock moonlets orbit the Plock-Karen barycenter.  Here it is:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     // OPM_CA_SigmaBinary.cfg by Geschosskopf
>     // Patch for OPM's CA file for if you have Sigma88's SigmaBinary installed.
>     //
>     // If you have SigmaBinary, this file will change the centralBody of the Plock moonlets to the
>     //   Plock-Karen barycenter.  No action required on your part.
>     
>     
>     // For SigmaBinary
>     @CustomAsteroids:NEEDS[SigmaBinary]:AFTER[SigmaBinary]
>     {@ASTEROIDGROUP[plockMoonlets]{	@centralBody = Plock-Karen}
>     }
> 

EDIT:

Actually, now that I take a closer look at OPM configs, it looks like you shouldn't change the central body

stuff should never put in orbit around a barycenter. asteroid spawning around Plock will work fine

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-02T21:37:11Z" title="06/02/2016 09:37  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 2, 2016</time> by Sigma88**

Regarding the KSPRC bug, I adjuste now th related file and works fine.

I was a bit confused with the loadondemand but was the useondemand line ;-)

However many Thanks for you fast response and again thank you for all the hard work and Support!!!
